India had set the target of 245 runs, in reply, Pakistan were bowled out on 137 runs.

350.title: US Secy of State meets Ukraine's Foreign Minister at Polish border
350.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba at Poland's border with Ukraine on Saturday. Blinken, who crossed the border into Ukraine, said, "The entire world stands with Ukraine, just as I'm standing here in Ukraine with my friend, my colleague." The two discussed Western efforts to support Ukraine and isolate Russia during the current war.

351.title: ITBP to hold 'Desh Ki Hifazat...' event on 75 yrs of independence
351.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) is going to organise 'Desh Ki Hifazat-Desh Ki Suraksha' programme from March 6 to 13 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of India's independence. Various programmes like honouring martyrs' families and band displays will be organised on the occasion, a press release by the ITBP said. Free medical camps will also be held, it added.

352.title: Chandigarh traffic police rally promotes use of helmets by women
352.article_body: The Chandigarh traffic police's Road Safety Awareness Week 2022 concluded with a two-wheeler rally on Saturday. The initiative was aimed at highlighting the importance of helmets for women. Around 200 women two-wheeler riders took part in the rally and displayed slogans on road safety. Special awareness workshops were organised in various colonies of the city and nearby villages.

353.title: Saudi defence firm plans to produce indigenous drones: State TV
353.article_body: Saudi Arabian Military Industries (SAMI), a state-owned defence firm has planned to produce indigenous drones, reported state TV al-Ekhbariya. "We are working to establish SAMI as the world's largest munitions factory and localising defence industries," said SAMI CEO Walid Abukhaled. As per al-Ekhbariya report, the kingdom plans to divert 50% of its military spending to Saudi companies by 2030.

354.title: Malayalam director Liju Krishna taken into custody over rape allegation
354.article_body: Malayalam director Liju Krishna has been taken into police custody following an allegation of rape by a crew member of his upcoming film 'Padavettu'. The shoot which was underway in Kerala's Kannur has been halted temporarily and further work on the film has been reportedly stopped following the allegation. 'Padavettu' was to be Liju's directorial debut in the film industry.

355.title: 421 of 454 MP citizens stuck in Ukraine have returned: State govt
355.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government on Sunday said 421 of the total 454 people hailing from the state have returned from war-hit Ukraine so far. "Some natives of the state are in transit while others are in the process of leaving Ukraine," state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said. He said all such natives of state are in touch with the government.

356.title: Working with father Naseeruddin is my dream, ambition: Vivaan
356.article_body: Actor Vivaan Shah has said that working with his father veteran actor Naseeruddin Shah is his dream and his ambition. He further said that his debut film '7 Khoon Maaf' starred the veteran actor but the two didn't share any scenes. "I know how wonderful it is to work with him because I have done that on stage," Vivaan added.

357.title: Well done: Laxman to India on their innings and 222-run 1st Test win vs SL
357.article_body: Praising India after their innings and 222-run win against Sri Lanka in first Test of two-match series, VVS Laxman took to Twitter and wrote, "Well done Team India." His tweet further read, "Virat Kohli's 100th Test...Ravichandran Ashwin getting past the great Kapil [Dev] paaji to become India's second highest test wicket-taker...Ravindra Jadeja [being] spectacular with both bat and ball."

358.title: 'Few men see women's heads as erogenous zones', jokes Twinkle on hijab row
358.article_body: Commenting on the hijab controversy, actress-turned-author Twinkle Khanna joked, "I must admit hearing a few religious leaders talk about how a hijab stops men from being tempted does make one chuckle." She added, "Very few men would consider a woman's head an erogenous zone. Can you imagine date-night conversations that include, 'Wow your head is looking so hot today'?"

359.title: Will accept refugees from Ukraine irrespective of nationality: Germany
359.article_body: Germany will accept refugees fleeing the Russian invasion of Ukraine irrespective of their nationality, German Interior Minister Nancy Faeser was quoted as saying by local media. "We want to save lives. That doesn't depend on [the refugees'] passport(s)," she added. Additionally, refugees from Ukraine will receive immediate protection of up to 3 years in the EU, Faeser had earlier said.

360.title: Russian gymnast wears war symbol 'Z' on podium next to Ukrainian gymnast
360.article_body: Russian gymnast Ivan Kuliak wore Russia's war symbol 'Z' on his chest as he stood on a podium next to his Ukrainian rival Illia Kovtun during an event in Doha, Qatar. While Kuliak won bronze on the parallel bars at the event, Kovtun won the gold medal. The symbol 'Z' has been spotted on Russian combat vehicles following Ukraine's invasion.

361.title: Over 15,920 Indians brought back from Ukraine under Op Ganga: Govt
361.article_body: India has brought back over 15,920 citizens in 76 flights from Ukraine under Operation Ganga, the government said on Sunday. It added that around 2,500 Indians were evacuated in 13 flights landed in the last 24 hours. Seven flights are scheduled from Hungary, Romania and Poland over the next 24 hours.

362.title: Today's India improving, innovating, influencing world: PM in Pune
362.article_body: While speaking at the golden jubilee celebrations of Pune's Symbiosis University, PM Narendra Modi said that today's India is innovating, improving and influencing the world. "From software to health, from artificial intelligence (AI) to electric vehicles, from drones to semiconductors, the government is bringing reforms in every sector to open up new opportunities for our youth," PM Modi added.

363.title: US & Poland in talks to deliver Soviet-era warplanes to Ukraine: Reports
363.article_body: The US along with Poland is considering a deal to send Soviet-era warplanes to Ukraine in order to boost its defense against the Russian invasions, as per reports. Reports suggest that Poland would send Soviet-era aircraft to Ukraine in exchange for F-16 fighter jets. "We’re looking at it very, very actively," said US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

364.title: Don't think so: Gambhir on Jadeja's 175* being called standout innings
364.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's 228-ball 175* against Sri Lanka in first Test, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said he didn't think that it was the standout innings of the all-rounder's Test career. "The innings Jadeja played in Australia or...outside India, he'll get more confidence from that. Stats can be very misleading." It's highest Test score for an Indian at number seven.

365.title: Ajay Devgn & I picked up exactly from where we left: Esha Deol
365.article_body: Actress Esha Deol has said she enjoyed reuniting with actor Ajay Devgn in 'Rudra: The Edge Of Darkness' and added, "We picked up exactly from where we left." "We worked together in the past in a few films but...I think both of us have grown as actors," Esha added. The duo shared screen space in films like 'Yuva' and 'Insan'.

366.title: I just thought, 'Oh my God, there it is': Farrell on Robert's Batsuit
366.article_body: Actor Colin Farrell revealed his first reaction after watching Robert Pattinson wearing the Batsuit on the sets of 'The Batman'. "I got out of the car, in full costume, full makeup, ready to shoot...I looked up on the roof...he [Robert] was looking down, the cape was blowing in the wind...I just thought, 'Oh my God, there it is'," Farrell stated.

367.title: US scientists spot potential afterglow from merger of 2 neutron stars
367.article_body: US scientists detected a potential afterglow from a kilonova, which occurs after two neutron stars merge to create a massive explosion. Originally detected by scientists in 2017, the blast formed a jet of high-energy particles which were replaced by X-rays in 2020. Researchers believed heated debris from the merger created a shock generating X-ray emissions, known as kilonova afterglow.

368.title: UN delivers $32 million to Afghanistan as part of humanitarian aid
368.article_body: UN's humanitarian aid worth $32 million reached Kabul, over a month after Afghanistan's central bank, Da Afghanistan Bank (DAB) announced to have received a similar aid package from UN. Appreciating the assistance, DAB also called on the international community to cooperate with Afghanistan for providing necessary banking facilities. Afghanistan plunged into crisis after Taliban assumed control in August last year.

369.title: Hong Kong reports over 31,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
369.article_body: Hong Kong on Sunday reported 31,008 new COVID-19 cases, 153 deaths in last 24 hours. As residents expressed concerns over a mass-testing scheme, Chief Secretary John Lee said detailed instructions of the scheme will be announced soon. He added authorities will ensure steady food supply. Last month, Chief Executive Carrie Lam announced three compulsory testing rounds for all starting mid-March.

370.title: Admit Ukraine-returnees in Indian colleges at govt cost: Digvijaya
370.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has urged the Centre to provide admissions to Ukraine-returned students in various private and government medical colleges in India. In a letter to PM Narendra Modi, Singh wrote that the Centre should make special plan to provide admissions "in interest of the country and public". He also demanded that government pay the fees of such students.

371.title: Woman abducted outside college in UP, gangraped by 5 men
371.article_body: A woman was allegedly abducted by five persons outside her college in UP's Muzaffarnagar who took her to Delhi in a car and gangraped her, police said on Sunday. The accused threatened the survivor against informing anyone about the incident and then dropped her off in Meerut, police added. A case has been registered against the accused.

372.title: Won't end campaign till Ukraine stops fighting: Putin as Turkey seeks ceasefire
372.article_body: In a phone call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, Russian President Vladimir Putin said the military campaign in Ukraine will not end until Kyiv lays down arms and agrees to all Russian demands. He said this after Erdogan appealed for a ceasefire. This came amid the UN's warning of the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War 2.

373.title: Drake files restraining order against alleged female stalker
373.article_body: Singer Drake has filed a restraining order against a 29-year-old woman who has allegedly been stalking his California home for a year. He has claimed that she sent him emails last month, one of which stated he should "put a bullet through [his] head now b*tch". Drake also alleged that she earlier filed a $4 billion "frivolous" lawsuit against him.

374.title: Let students returning from Ukraine study in India: Odisha CM
374.article_body: Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Sunday wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and urged him to "enable and facilitate continuance of...studies [of students returning from Ukraine] in the medical colleges in India". He said that they must be allowed to continue "from the stage from which their studies in Ukraine have been disrupted on account of the war".

375.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after India's win?
375.article_body: After defeating Sri Lanka by an innings and 222 runs in the Mohali Test, India have accumulated 65 points on the World Test Championship points table. India are fifth on the table with 54.16% of points won. Sri Lanka are third with 66.66% of points won. Australia are on top of the table with 86.66% of points won.

376.title: I'm not just a pretty face, voice; always want seat at table: Sona
376.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra has said that she is not just a pretty face or voice and has always wanted a seat at the table, adding she's never been shy about stating it. She further said late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar was the only one in her times among men and women who stood up for issues like copyrights and royalties.

377.title: AIMIM leader injured after being attacked with spade in Ahmedabad
377.article_body: AIMIM Gujarat leader Shamshad Pathan was injured after being attacked with a spade by a group of four people in Ahmedabad on Sunday, police said. He was attacked when he intervened in a fight in a market in the city. Pathan was hospitalised and his condition is stable, an official said.

378.title: Andhra Police seize cash, gold worth ₹5 cr from bus passengers
378.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool Police on Sunday seized gold biscuits, silver and cash worth ₹5 crore while conducting a routine check at an Andhra-Telangana border check post. Five people travelling in a private bus from Hyderabad to Coimbatore, who were carrying the valuables, were detained after they failed to produce valid documents for transporting them. An investigation is underway.

379.title: 114 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar arrive in Indonesia by boat
379.article_body: As many as 114 Rohingya refugees from Myanmar arrived by boat in Indonesia on Sunday, an NGO group at the scene said. Some of the people in the group needed medical assistance when they arrived in Aceh province, a volunteer for the NGO said. Authorities were unsure for how long the 114 refugees had been at sea, the volunteer added.

380.title: We repeat, close the sky over Ukraine: Zelenskyy as Russian missiles destroy airport
380.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a video urged Western nations to impose a no-fly zone over Ukraine following an attack by Russian missiles that destroyed Ukraine's Vinnytsia airport. "We repeat every day: Close the sky over Ukraine," said Zelenskyy. He added, "If you don't do that, if you don't give us aircraft, you also want us to be slowly killed."

381.title: Cuban boxer loses 80% vision after pressure cooker explodes
381.article_body: A Cuban boxer has severely burned both his corneas and reportedly lost 80% of his vision after a pressure cooker exploded. As per Guillermo Rigondeaux's manager, the boxer was cooking Cuban black beans when the pressure cooker exploded, splashing boiling water into his eyes and chest. He added that it was unclear as to what caused the cooker to explode.

382.title: Everyone keeps asking me for it: Peyush Bansal as he shares updates on Kamlesh
382.article_body: Lenskart Co-founder Peyush Bansal on Sunday took to Instagram and wrote, "Everyone I meet these days has one question...What is the update on jugaadu Kamlesh from Shark Tank India?" Bansal informed, "We've initiated a process of design and consumer validation of the cart." He added, "Biggest concerns are: Weight of Cart, movement on different uneven terrains and width of cart."

383.title: BJP is winning 80% of UP seats, no room for 'ifs & buts': CM Yogi
383.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Sunday exuded confidence in winning 80% of the state's total Assembly seats in the ongoing elections and added that there was no room for "ifs and buts". "Our party's politics revolves around development. It is the opposition that has no agenda and keeps talking about casteism and communal polarisation," he added.

384.title: 19-year-old who tracked Musk's jet to now track Russian billionaires' yachts
384.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old student who tracks the world's richest person Elon Musk's private jet, has now created a Twitter account to track the yachts of Russian billionaires, including President Vladimir Putin. Sweeney had started tracking the aircraft of some of Russia's richest people at the end of February after they came under sanctions pressure following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

385.title: You boost your confidence with such performance: Jadeja on his 175*, 9/87
385.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who scored 175* and took 9/87 in his side's win against Sri Lanka in first Test, said, "Obviously as a player you boost your confidence with such a performance." He added, "I haven't done anything differently, just played to my strengths...I give myself time to settle down." India won by an innings and 222 runs.

386.title: BJP to contest 12 seats in Bihar MLC elections: State party chief
386.article_body: Bihar BJP chief Sanjay Jaiswal said on Sunday that the party will contest 12 out of the 24 seats in the upcoming state Legislative Council (MLC) elections. Jaiswal added that BJP has "no issue on any seat with JD(U)". Elections to the MLC seats will be held on April 4 and counting of votes will take place on April 7.

387.title: Divya announces split from Varun Sood, says 'He'll be my best friend'
387.article_body: Bigg Boss OTT winner Divya Agarwal took to Instagram to announce her split from actor Varun Sood on Sunday. "I hereby formally declare that I'm on my own in this life...I really value and love all the happy moments I spent with him. He's a great guy! He will always be my best friend," she captioned her post.

388.title: Ravindra Jadeja's batting has gone one notch higher: Ashwin
388.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 175 runs in the first Test against Sri Lanka, Ravichandran Ashwin said Jadeja's batting has gone "one notch higher". "Jadeja has...come a long way in the last four-five years...his position is a little low for the way he is batting at the moment," Ashwin stated. India won the Test by an innings and 222 runs.

389.title: Time to form iron government of BSP in UP: Mayawati
389.article_body: Ahead of voting for the final phase of the UP Assembly polls, Bahujan Samaj Party President Mayawati on Sunday said, "It's necessary to form an 'iron government' of BSP to ensure...welfare and happiness of all." "The neglected people facing poverty and unemployment can work to change their fate and that of the state with...power of their votes," she tweeted.

390.title: Fruit vendor stabs father-son duo over monetary dispute; arrested
390.article_body: A fruit vendor was arrested from Mumbai's Malad for allegedly stabbing a father-son duo over a monetary issue. The accused had taken a consignment of apples worth  ₹35,000 from the victims. Police said the accused attacked the 55-year-old man and his 30-year-old son with a knife and sickle as he was unable to pay the money back despite repeated arguments.

391.title: Moody's cuts Russia's credit rating to 2nd-lowest on its scale
391.article_body: Moody's Investors Service on Sunday cut Russia's credit rating to Ca, the second-lowest rung of its ratings ladder. Moody's said its decision was "driven by severe concerns around Russia's willingness and ability to pay its debt obligations". "At the Ca rating level, the recovery expectations are at 35% to 65% (of face value)," Moody's said.

392.title: Epic Games, Activision Blizzard stop selling their games in Russia
392.article_body: Epic Games and Activision Blizzard have stopped selling their games in Russia after it launched the invasion of Ukraine. 'Fortnite' developer Epic Games said it will not block Russian players from accessing its games. "We are doing everything possible to assist employees, and their families, who are being directly affected by this tragedy," Activision Blizzard's President Daniel Alegre said.

393.title: 1 killed, over 20 injured in grenade attack in Srinagar market
393.article_body: A 70-year-old man was killed and over 20 others, including a policeman, were injured in a grenade attack by terrorists at the busy Amira Kadal market in Srinagar on Sunday. The policeman was discharged from the hospital after treatment. The Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) said the attack was aimed at security forces.

394.title: Didn't expect Test to finish by Day 3: Karunaratna on SL's loss vs India
394.article_body: Sri Lanka Test skipper Dimuth Karunaratna said his side never thought that the first Test against India in Mohali would get over by Day 3 after the visitors' innings and 222-run defeat. "The batters need to put their hands up and bat longer innings," he stated. Batting first, India declared their first innings at 574/8 on Day 2.

395.title: China's Qingdao reports outbreak of Omicron variant among students
395.article_body: China's Qingdao has reported an outbreak of Omicron variant mainly among middle school students in Laixi county, the city's Municipal Health Commission said. In response, authorities will carry out mass testing for COVID-19 on March 7. The city had reported 88 COVID-19 cases on March 5, all of them of the Omicron variant.

396.title: I find it difficult to meditate, I use NSDR to relax: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
396.article_body: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai in an interview with The Wall Street Journal spoke about how he relaxes, and said, "I found these podcasts which are non-sleep deep rest, or NSDRs." He said, "While I find it difficult to meditate, I can go to YouTube, find an NSDR video." He added, "They're available in 10, 20 or 30 minutes."

397.title: Russian banks to switch to China's UnionPay as Visa, Mastercard cut links
397.article_body: Sberbank, Russia's biggest lender, along with Alfa Bank and Tinkoff on Sunday said they would soon start issuing cards using the Chinese UnionPay card operator's system coupled with Russia's Mir network. This comes after Visa and MasterCard suspended their operations in Russia owing to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Payments company PayPal also suspended its operations in Russia on Saturday.

398.title: Congress, NCP organise protests against PM Modi’s Pune visit
398.article_body: The Congress and the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) staged protests in Pune on Sunday against PM Narendra Modi's visit to inaugurate various development projects. Pune city Congress unit president Ramesh Bagwe said that PM Modi was inaugurating "incomplete projects and cheating the people of Pune." PM Modi on Sunday inaugurated the Pune Metro Rail project.

399.title: CredAvenue becomes India's 11th unicorn of 2022 after $137 mn fundraise
399.article_body: CredAvenue has become a unicorn after it raised $137 million, taking its total valuation to $1.3 billion within 18 months of inception, the company said on Sunday. CredAvenue is India's 11th startup to turn unicorn in 2022 after the likes of Mamaearth and Xpressbees. Founded by Gaurav Kumar, CredAvenue acts as a marketplace to connect enterprises to lenders and investors.

400.title: Will continue mediation efforts on Russia-Ukraine crisis: Israel PM
400.article_body: Israel will continue its efforts to mediate on the Russia-Ukraine crisis even if chances of success seem unlikely, PM Naftali Bennett said on Sunday. PM Bennett's remarks come a day after his meeting on the conflict with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow. Notably, Israel has condemned the ongoing Russian military offensive and also sent humanitarian aid to Ukraine.
